entry.title: Clock Tower of Haridwar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Clock Tower of Haridwar (pictured) in India provides a good location from which to watch the evening prayers at Har Ki Pauri?

entry.title: murder and dismemberment of his stepdaughter and her fiancé in 1982 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dale Johnston was declared innocent of the murder and dismemberment of his stepdaughter and her fiancé in 1982, 30 years after being sentenced to death for it?

entry.title: Kasman Singodimedjo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1945, Kasman Singodimedjo lobbied other Islamist leaders not to implement sharia law in Indonesia?

entry.title: posthumous vocals in a song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a woman who died from Alzheimer's was memorialized by her granddaughter through posthumous vocals in a song?

entry.title: Tobi Oluwayemi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tobi Oluwayemi and his older brother Josh are both goalkeepers who played for Tottenham's youth academy?

entry.title: Meriden, Waterbury and Connecticut River Railroad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Meriden, Waterbury and Connecticut River Railroad, created as an alternative to the New Haven Railroad, was absorbed into the New Haven after just 11 years?

entry.title: Kong Dongmei (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kong Dongmei, the granddaughter of Mao Zedong, and her husband have an estimated net worth of 5 billion yuan (US$815 million)?

entry.title: ice fishing in Turkey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that there is ice fishing in Turkey?
